title: filter_with_scrublet
description:
Doublet detection using the Scrublet method (Wolock, Lopez and Klein, 2019).
The method tests for potential doublets by using the expression profiles of
cells to generate synthetic potential doubles which are tested against cells. 
The method returns a "doublet score" on which it calls for potential doublets.

For the source code please visit https://github.com/AllonKleinLab/scrublet.

For 10x we expect the doublet rates to be:
  Multiplet Rate (%) - # of Cells Loaded - # of Cells Recovered
  ~0.4% ~800 ~500
  ~0.8% ~1,600 ~1,000
  ~1.6% ~3,200 ~2,000
  ~2.3% ~4,800 ~3,000
  ~3.1% ~6,400 ~4,000
  ~3.9% ~8,000 ~5,000
  ~4.6% ~9,600 ~6,000
  ~5.4% ~11,200 ~7,000
  ~6.1% ~12,800 ~8,000
  ~6.9% ~14,400 ~9,000
  ~7.6% ~16,000 ~10,000

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file

layer.description: Type: `string`. Input layer to use as data for calculating doublets
layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Input layer to use as data for calculating doublets. .X is used not specified.

output.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file.

output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

obs_name_filter.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `filter_with_scrublet`. In which .obs slot to store a boolean array corresponding to which observations should be filtered out.

do_subset.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Whether to subset before storing the output.

min_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `2`. The number of minimal UMI counts per cell that have to be present for initial cell detection.

min_cells.description: Type: `integer`, default: `3`. The number of cells in which UMIs for a gene were detected
min_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `3`. The number of cells in which UMIs for a gene were detected.

min_gene_variablity_percent.description: Type: `double`, default: `85.0`. Used for gene filtering prior to PCA
min_gene_variablity_percent.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `85.0`. Used for gene filtering prior to PCA. Keep the most highly variable genes (in the top min_gene_variability_pctl percentile), as measured by the v-statistic [Klein et al., Cell 2015].
